q: December, Barack Obama reportedly called the owner of the Philadelphia Eagles to support the team's willingness to give Michael Vick a second chance. The Eagles' commitment to Michael Vick has been clear since they signed him in 2009: If a person made a terrible mistake and then paid their debts to society, was deeply remorseful and turned their life around completely... would you be willing to help this human being move forward? Despite these public displays of support, Michael Vick has faced intense scrutiny and criticism since his 2007 arrest and conviction for a series of crimes related to dog fighting.
